owl:Ontology.dc:creator: María Poveda-Villalón (Ontology Engineering Group, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
Serge Chávez-Feria (Ontology Engineering Group, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The material properties ontology provides the vocabulary to describe physical properties related to components, materials and layer in a building context.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Material properties ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a feature of interest and a measurement about it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has measurement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship identifying the unit of measure used for a certain entity.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is measured in

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a feature of interest and a property of that feature.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a property and the measurements it relates to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: relates to measurement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a measurement and the property it relates to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: relates to property

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between the material property definition and the source database where it was found.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: source database

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship defining the value of a certain property, e.g., energy or power. Note that, even if numeric values are expected to enable reasoning, measurement values could use other datatypes.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has value

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Concrete with expanded clay or brick chippings aggregate
Insulating materials from renewable raw material

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A homogeneous or inhomogeneous substance that can be used to form elements (physical products or their components). (Definition taken from IFC)
IfcMaterial is a homogeneous or inhomogeneous substance that can be used to form elements (physical products or their components). (Definition taken from IFC 4.1)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material
Reinforced concrete / normal concrete with reinforcement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A feature of interest represents any real world entity from which a property is measured. (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Feature of interest

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement. (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Measurement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A quality of a feature of interest that can be measured; an aspect of a feature of interest that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the feature. (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Property

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended, also using some other ontologies rather than the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Unit of measure

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Abiotic depletion potential for fossil resources (ADPF)
Abiotic depletion potential for non fossil resources (ADPE)
Acidification potential of soil and water (AP)
Backside solar reflectance at normal incidence (BSSRNI)
Backside visible reflectance at normal incidence (BSVRNI)
Depletion potential of the stratospheric layer (ODP)
Frontside visible reflectance at normal incidence (FSVRNI)
Total use of non renewable primary energy resource (PENRT)
Total use of renewable primary energy (PERT)
Use of non renewable primary energy (PENRE)
Use of non renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PENRM)
Use of non renewable secondary fuels (NRSF)
Use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PERM)
Window glass spectral data set name (WGSDSN)
